title: Bug 7734: System can be shut down without save file warnings
description: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file.
OB: When the user shuts down Windows without saving the changes in the dirty .txt file, there is no warning or question message box to give users a chance to save their changes.
EB: When the user shuts down Windows without saving the changes in the dirty .txt file, a warning or question message box should appear, giving users a chance to save their changes before proceeding with the shutdown.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Start WSWB and create a new project.
2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it.
3. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file.
4. Left click on the Windows Start menu and select the "Shut Down..." command to shutdown/reboot the computer.

Expected results:
- A warning or question message box should appear, giving users a chance to save their dirty model(s) before proceeding with the shutdown.

Actual results:
- There is no warning or question message box, and the computer is shut down/rebooted immediately.
